greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of excedances in all odd permutations of {1,2,...,n} with no fixed points.
link: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..300
R. Mantaci and F. Rakotondrajao, Exceedingly deranging!, Advances in Appl. Math., 30 (2003), 177-188.
example: a(4)=12 because the odd derangements of {1,2,3,4} are 4123, 3142, 4312, 2413, 2341 and 3421, having 1, 2, 2, 2, 3 and 2, excedances, respectively.
results.author: _Emeric Deutsch_, Nov 06 2008
